definition: to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
pillow/to pillow/to rest one's head on (Taiwan pr. [zhen4] for this sense)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning

sentences.english: A clear conscience is a soft pillow.
This recumbent had established the acting industry company that enjoy the cool greatly, as before cannot have nothing worry about.
sentences.chinese: 這個靠着大樹好乘涼的代工企業，依舊不能高枕無憂。

sentences.english: Will having a degree insulate you from getting laid off?
sentences.chinese: 是否有了學位就能讓你高枕無憂，遠離裁員呢？

sentences.english: But he was quickly assured that he could rest easy.
sentences.chinese: 但他很快就放心，他可以高枕無憂。

sentences.english: And I'll get to sleep at night.
sentences.chinese: 我這下子可以高枕無憂了。

sentences.english: But President Hu Jintao will still be worrying.
sentences.chinese: 但是胡主席遠沒有因此而高枕無憂。

definition: fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
Cona county, Tibetan: Mtsho sna rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to be determined to win (idiom)
calm/unruffled
to boast
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
fight to the death/desperate struggle
magnanimous
